topic.title: @Sirenyc: Is ZeroTV down ? why all is black now?

3_17vKbxL13KnzGATstqawXSG2oiQygmdkcX.body:
> @kaffie：
It is very pity, I have not backup this site. So now backup Play is a good choice.

And Who have backup ZeroTV ? Please public it again.

> [testset](#comment_61_17VwZEfWSUWb5RHkK9m1odnDdBfvjTL6Cp): I have tried to recover the deleted files with testdisk, but all of them is empty?!It seems like it was a more systematic data wipe than a simple delete.  [...]

Here has a part of ZeroTV's backup, not all .Thanks @p2p: 
http://127.0.0.1:43110/17iF64gTLycSohUSJsFyq7FMYsQfMqghJa/loader/files/1BEJbnufyav7TK23ADTs2Qi2UJeKSGDzw6.tar.gz

Maybe somebody has the whole backup.

> [kaffie](#comment_305_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): That'd require versioning, and take up more drive space for everyone.

Just set a version control as optional plugin. default disable

> [1491301186](#comment_20_1AZG3avnpwcn37q9eeCEjXKFBye81eAxg5): A complete copy of ZeroTV as it was on Mar 25, 2017 can be found at:https://zeronet.korso.win/1BEJbnufyav7TK23ADTs2Qi2UJeKSGDzw6

How to backup it?

@Rythyrix: 
Have you downloaded it ? I have offline the index.html, but not magnet link. the `korso.win` proxy make have set no peer found itself

> [rythyrix](#comment_94_18eGWSaM3Vc9i61LVfogjQJf5gp7EN7b9Y): On its way. Careful if you try it yourself; the code I posted earlier has a couple of issues due to backslashes being interpreted in the comment box, and is not identical to that which I wrote in my shell. Do you want the files as well? I'll have to actually upload a zip of it for multiple people to use.

Yes, you can upload a zip, thanks :) only has the [content.json on 2017.03.25](http://127.0.0.1:43110/17iF64gTLycSohUSJsFyq7FMYsQfMqghJa/?17vKbxL13KnzGATstqawXSG2oiQygmdkcX_0) can't download the site.maybe all peers have updated.

> [rythyrix](#comment_95_18eGWSaM3Vc9i61LVfogjQJf5gp7EN7b9Y): For those interested, here is the zip of scraped files from the proxy below.

Thank you very much, I have downloaded it :) But all the html are error pages.
